urn:taro:utexas.blac.00056 Relaciones Geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas of Mexico and Guatemala, 1577-1585 Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Apex Data Services, July 2001. Finding aid written in English. February 20, 2003Edited with XMetal3 by Bob Stewart followingTARO EAD V.1 Editing for BLAC Finding Aids. Tue Jul 22 14:58:33 CDT 2003urn:taro:utexas.blac.00056 converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (20030505). Descriptive Summary Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta, Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn, 1825-1894 Collection of Relaciones Geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas of Mexico and Guatemala 1577-1585 43 relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas, including 37 pinturas. Spanish 34022876 Original manuscripts and maps created in response to the first survey of New Spain by King Philip II include historical, cultural, and geographical information about the region in the 16th century. Benson Latin American Collection, The University of Texas at Austin Historical Note

On May 25, 1577, King Philip II of Spain ordered by royal c\ufffd\ufffddula the preparation of a general description of Spain's holdings in the Indies. Instructions and a questionnaire, issued in 1577 by the Office of the Cronista Mayor-Cosm\ufffd\ufffdgrafo, were distributed to local officials in the Viceroyalties of New Spain and Peru to direct the gathering of information. The questionnaire, comprised of fifty items, was designed to elicit basic information about the nature of the land and the life of its peoples. The replies, known as "relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas," were written between 1579 and 1585 and were returned to the Cronista Mayor-Cosm\ufffd\ufffdgrafo in Spain by the Council of the Indies.

 Scope and Contents Note

The collection consists of forty-three relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas (one a 19th-century copy) prepared by local officials in New Spain in response to the 1577 questionnaire mandated by King Philip II. Forty-one relaciones pertain to territory in present-day Mexico; two relate to what is now Guatemala. The relaciones contain historical, cultural, and geographical information on New Spain and its peoples during the 16th century and before the Conquest. The <emph render="italic">Relaci\ufffd\ufffdn de Texcoco</emph> is a 19th-century manuscript copy; another copy of this relaci\ufffd\ufffdn, probably made in the 17th century, is part of the Genaro Garc\ufffd\ufffda Collection in Benson.

Twenty-one relaciones are accompanied by printed questionnaires; 26 relaciones are accompanied by one or more maps, known as pinturas. The 37 pinturas are significant in their own right, not only as adjuncts to the texts. In addition to conveying historical information about such topics as 16th-century architecture, the spread of European religion in New Spain, and the colonial economy, the pinturas are artifacts for the study of the history of Latin American art and manuscript painting.

 Arrangement

Arranged numerically among other items in Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta's <emph render="italic">Colecci\ufffd\ufffdn de manuscritos relativos a la historia de Am\ufffd\ufffdrica, </emph><num>vols. XX, XXIII-XXV. </num>

 Acquisition Information

The relaciones were acquired by Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta in 1853 from an unknown private source.

The relaciones were included in the Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta Collection purchased by the Benson Latin American Collection from the heirs of Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta in 1937.

 Processing Information

The Relaciones Geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas were described by the Benson's Mexican Archives Project in March 1994.

Finding aid initially prepared by the Mexican Archives Project.

 Preferred Citation

Relaciones Geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas of Mexico and Guatemala, 1577-1585, Benson Latin American Collection, General Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.

 Alternate Form Available

Also available on microfilm in the Benson Collection.

An online exhibit of some of the relaciones is available at http://www.lib.utexas.edu/benson/rg/

 Index Terms

The relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas are classified under the following Subject Headings in the University of Texas Libraries' catalog:

Art--16th century--New Spain. Indians of Mexico--Art Indians of Mexico--History--Sources. Manuscripts, Mexican New Spain--Description and travel. New Spain--History--Sources. New Spain--Maps, Manuscript. Spain--Colonies--History--Sources. Mexico--History--16th century--Sources. Guatemala--History--16th century--Sources. Other Entries Spain. Sovereigns, etc., 1556-1598 (Philip II) Instrucci\ufffd\ufffdn y memoria, de las relaciones que se han de hazer, para la descripci\ufffd\ufffdn de las Indias. Place Names in the Relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas Acapistla (Mexico) Ameca (Mexico) Amula (Mexico) Antequera (Mexico) Atengo (Mexico) Atepeque (Mexico) Atitl\ufffd\ufffdn(Guatemala) Atlatlauca (Mexico) Ayusuchiquilazala (Mexico) Cempoala (Mexico) Cholula de Rivadabia (Mexico) Citlaltepec (Mexico) Coatzocoalco (Esp\ufffd\ufffdritu Santo) Cuautla (Mexico) Cuilapa (Guatemala) Culhuac\ufffd\ufffdn (Mexico) Cusalapa (Mexico) Cuzcatl\ufffd\ufffdn (Mexico) Epazoyuca (Mexico) Guaxtepec (Mexico) Gueytlalpa (Mexico) Iguala (Mexico) Ixcatl\ufffd\ufffdn (Mexico) Ixtapalapa (Mexico) Iztepec (Guatemala) Justlavaca (Mexico) Meztitl\ufffd\ufffdn (Mexico) Mistepeque (Mexico) Mizantla (Mexico) Oaxtepec (Mexico) P\ufffd\ufffdtzcuaro (Mexico) Puetla (Mexico) Pe\ufffd\ufffdoles (Mexico) Quatlatlauca (Mexico) Quer\ufffd\ufffdtaro (Mexico) Suchitepequex (Guatemala) Tanatepec (Mexico) Tanc\ufffd\ufffdtaro (Mexico) Tecuicuilco (Mexico) Tehuantepec (Mexico) Tenamaztl\ufffd\ufffdn (Mexico) Tepetongo (Mexico) Tequaltiche (Mexico) Teozacoalco (Mexico) Tequisquiac (Mexico) Tetiquipa (Mexico) Tetlistaca (Mexico) Texcoco (Mexico) Tiripit\ufffd\ufffdo (Mexico) Tistla-Zumpango (Mexico) Tuscacuesco (Mexico) Tutupetongo (Mexico) Veracruz (Veracruz-Llave, Mexico) Xaltianguis (Mexico) Xicayan (Mexico) Xilocingo (Mexico) Xocoticpaque (Mexico) Zacatepec (Mexico) Zacatula (Mexico) Zapotitlan (Guatemala) Zoquiapa (Mexico) Compilers of the Relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas Aguero, Francisco de. Alfonso de Estrada, Hernando Avila, Pedro de Aznar de Cozar, Andr\ufffd\ufffds Cangas, Suero de Carrion, Juan de, fl. 1581. Casta\ufffd\ufffdeda Leon, Juan de Cervantes, Hernando de Chavez, Gabriel de Estrada, Juan de Franco, Pedro Galdos, Alonso de Gallegos, Gonzalo Gallegos, Hernando Guti\ufffd\ufffdrrez de Li\ufffd\ufffdbana, Juan Hernandez Diosdado, Alonso Leyva, Antonio de Lopez de Z\ufffd\ufffdrate, Juan Macarro, Sebastian Martinez, Francisco Martinez, Juan Mendez, Andr\ufffd\ufffds Montes de Oca, Pedro de Obregon, Lu\ufffd\ufffds Pati\ufffd\ufffdo Avila, Alvaro Perez de Arteaga, Diego Pomar, Juan Bautista, fl. 1582. Rojas, Gabriel de Salas, Christoval de Salazar, Agust\ufffd\ufffdn de Sol\ufffd\ufffds, Gaspar de Suarez, Melchor Torres, Juan de Vargas, Antonio de Vascones, Hernando de Velasquez de Lara, Gonzalo Villegas, Francisco de Related Material Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta Manuscript Collection, [1500]-1887, Benson Latin American Collection, General Libraries, The University of Texas at Austin.

Other relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas are held by the Real Academia de Historia (Madrid) and the Archivo General de Indias (Seville).

 Other Finding Aids

The following guides, as well as a card file and lists, are available in the Benson Collection Rare Books Reference:

Garc\ufffd\ufffda Icazbalceta, Joaqu\ufffd\ufffdn. <emph render="italic">Catalogo de la colecci\ufffd\ufffdn de manuscritos relativos a la historia de America.</emph> Monograf\ufffd\ufffdas bibliogr\ufffd\ufffdficas Mexicanas,n\ufffd\ufffdm. 9.Mexico City,Impr. de la secretaria de relaciones exteriores,1927.

Casta\ufffd\ufffdeda, Carlos Eduardo, 1896-1958. <emph render="italic">Guide to the Latin American Manuscripts in the University of Texas Library. </emph>Cambridge, Mass.,Harvard University Press, 1939.

 Bibliography

The relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas have been published in:

Acu\ufffd\ufffda, Ren\ufffd\ufffd. <emph render="italic"> Relaciones geogr\ufffd\ufffdficas del siglo XVI. </emph>1a \ufffd\ufffdd. M\ufffd\ufffdxico : Universidad Nacional Auton\ufffd\ufffdma de M\ufffd\ufffdxico, Instituto de Investigaciones Antropol\ufffd\ufffdgicas, 1982- 10+ v.
